newsitem.title: POLAND: Amerbank mulls various share issues.
newsitem.headline: Amerbank mulls various share issues.

text.p: Poland's Bank Amerykanski w Polsce Amerbank SA (Amerbank) is mulling a regular share issue as well as one to a strategic investor, the bank's deputy president said on Wednesday.
Wlodzimierz Paszkowski told Reuters that shortly before the bank's planned shareholders meeting on November 15 it would make clear on what kind of issue the shareholders would vote.
"We will propose a text for a potential new share issue but details of the size or how it will be addressed we will be much clearer in the next two weeks," Paszkowski told Reuters.
Paszkowski said Amerbank was seeking funds to boost its lending operations and to have the option to engage in capital investment projects in financial or non-financial firms.
"Our regular banking activities are expanding so fast, together with our clients...that we have to increase our own funds and match this with assets we can lend to our clients," he said.
Earlier in the day Paszkowski told Reuters the bank hoped to find a minority strategic investor by the end of the year who would help provide the Polish bank with expertise.
